intro: Endlicheria sericea, commonly known as the silky endlicheria, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. It produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers, which are followed by small, round berries. Endlicheria sericea is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky crevices.
